head.title: Eileen M. Kenny Weds M. E. Helmer in Jersey

hedline.hl1: Eileen M. Kenny Weds M. E. Helmer in Jersey

block.p: LEAD: Eileen Mary Kenny, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene F. Kenny of Basking Ridge, N.J., was married there yesterday to Michael Edward Helmer, a son of Dr. and Mrs. William F. Helmer of Morrisville, N.Y. The Rev. John Davis, a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony.

LEAD: Eileen Mary Kenny, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene F. Kenny of Basking Ridge, N.J., was married there yesterday to Michael Edward Helmer, a son of Dr. and Mrs. William F. Helmer of Morrisville, N.Y. The Rev. John Davis, a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony.

Eileen Mary Kenny, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene F. Kenny of Basking Ridge, N.J., was married there yesterday to Michael Edward Helmer, a son of Dr. and Mrs. William F. Helmer of Morrisville, N.Y. The Rev. John Davis, a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Helmer, a portfolio assistant in the trust and estate department at the Bankers Trust Company in New York, and her husband both graduated with the class of '84 from St. Lawrence University. The bride's father is a vice president of C. E. Maguire Inc., an architectural and engineering concern in Wayne, N.J. Her mother, Mary Kenny, is a sales assistant at the Talbots in Morristown, N.J.

The bridegroom, an assistant treasurer in the commodity financing division of the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York, expects to graduate in May from the Fordham University School of Law. His father retired as dean of general studies at the State University Agricultural and Technical College at Morrisville, where his mother, Joan Helmer, is an associate professor of English.
